intro: Cyphostemma vanderbenii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
